Content:: The sphenoidal spine (Latin: "spina angularis") is a downwardly directed process at the apex of the great wings of the sphenoid bone that serves as the origin of the sphenomandibular ligament.[1] Base of skull. Inferior surface. Spine of sphenoid bone marked with black circle  This human musculoskeletal system article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
